column1: Amino acids are organic compounds that combine to form proteins.

The human body uses amino acids to make proteins to help the body: - Break down food - Grow - Repair body tissue - Perform many other body functions Amino acids can also be used as a source of energy by the body.
- The 9 essential amino acids are: histidine, isoleucine, leucine, lysine, methionine, phenylalanine, threonine, tryptophan, and valine.
